draggableitem.item: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend is about a young lawyer named Rebecca Bunch who follows a crush to California.
Similar to Jason's machete or Freddy Krueger's claws, Leatherface wields a chainsaw to attack his victims.
Romantic comedies used to be a common option at movie theaters, but recently Netflix has taken over the genre.
Crazy Ex-Girlfriend's humor derives from the use of original songs to explain Rebecca's feelings.
The Texas Chainsaw Massacre was first released in 1974 and has seen seven sequels and remakes since.
Rebecca Bunch is relatable because the audience gets to relive the experience of unrequited love.
Leatherface's chainsaw is effective at terrorizing because its size and shape make it an intimidating tool.
Romantic comedies are well suited to solitary viewing, making Netflix the perfect distribution medium.
Some of Crazy Ex-Girlfriend's best punch lines are delivered through music, which helps them land better.
Like previous versions, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (2003) serves as a time capsule for the early 2000s.
